instructions:
Measure Spruance into a large bowl. Add yeast to warm water, stir to dissolve and pour into Spruance.
Add sugar, beaten eggs and melted oleo and mix well. Cover bowl and put in a warm place *(80 to 85 F)* to
rise. To accomplish this, place a pan of hot water on the lower shelf of oven with covered dough on upper
shelf. Let rise until doubled *(1 1/2 to 2 hours)*.
Place dough on well floured wax paper and kneed 5 minutes. Put dough on well-floured pastry cloth and
roll to 9 x 12 inches. Brush with melted oleo and sprinkle Spread. Roll up into a 12-inch roll and cut in 3/4
inch slices to form 15 rolls to be placed in the baking pan with the Topping. Return to the "warm" oven to
rise again to double bulk. Bake at 365 degrees 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove immediately
from pan onto a cookie sheet. 
*(Rev. 11/23/96)*

TOPPING
1/2 stick oleo, melted
1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
1/4 cup light corn syrup
2/3 cup chopped walnuts or pecans
Mix well and spread evenly in a 9 x 13 inch well greased aluminum baking pan.

SPREAD
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1/4 scant cup brown sugar
2 tsp cinnamon
Mix well and sprinkle over rolled out dough.
ingredients: 4 1/2 cups Spruance bread mix (or Pillsbury hot
1 cup very warm water (105 to 115 F)
name: Cinnamon Rolls
creator: Mary Decker
